notes.title: WEEK 1
notes.content:

notes.title: WEEK 2
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 2: Recovering a Sense of Identity

Reclaiming your creative identity by releasing external expectations, setting boundaries, and rediscovering what you want to say, make, and explore.

ğŸ§  Noticing how othersâ€™ opinions shaped your self-concept ğŸš« Saying no to people-pleasing and over-responsibility ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Stepping into authenticity and creative self-definition ğŸ“£ Beginning to hear your own voice again

ğŸª© Look for â€œPoisonous Playmatesâ€ â€“ who distracts or drains you? ğŸšª Practice setting small, safe boundaries ğŸ§  List things you used to enjoy that youâ€™ve stopped doing ğŸ–¼ï¸ Reclaim one forgotten interest or curiosity this week ğŸ—£ï¸ Write about something youâ€™ve been afraid to say out loud ğŸ“š Declutter your mental space: limit unhelpful input (news, gossip, social scrolling) ğŸ§ Pay attention to what energizes or exhausts your creative self ğŸ§¹ Identify places youâ€™re over-helping or over-doingâ€”then step back gently ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Ask: What do I want to create for meâ€”not for approval?

notes.content:

Whatâ€™s it pointing to? ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸ Journal where you feel blocked and who/what might be contributing ğŸ§  Track resistance this weekâ€”when did it show up and why? ğŸ“œ Write about one shaming moment from your pastâ€”get it out ğŸ¯ Do something youâ€™ve been avoiding creatively (even one tiny step!) ğŸ—£ï¸ Say what you mean at least once this weekâ€”no sugarcoating ğŸ§â€â™€ï¸ Make a mini â€œI wantâ€ listâ€”no edits, just honesty ğŸ’¥ Identify where youâ€™ve been hiding or holding back in your art ğŸ’Œ Write a love letter to your boldest creative self ğŸŒ± Reflect on the power of truth in your pagesâ€”whatâ€™s rising up?

notes.title: WEEK 4
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 4: Recovering a Sense of Integrity

Focus:

Realigning with your truth by clearing out distractions, becoming more honest with yourself, and listening deeply to what your inner artist actually needsâ€”without numbing, avoiding, or overconsuming.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes

ğŸ›‘ Reading deprivation = clarity, not punishment ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Distraction is often disguised avoidance ğŸ§  Telling the truth (even to yourself) restores creative power ğŸ’¡ Integrity is about alignmentâ€”doing what feels real and right

ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

ğŸ“µ Reading Deprivation â€“ one week of no books, articles, or content consumption ğŸ““ Use Morning Pages to process your reactions to less input ğŸ‘€ Notice what you want to read when you canâ€™tâ€”whatâ€™s the craving covering up? ğŸ–¼ï¸ Make space to hear your inner voice without noise ğŸ§¹ Declutter something physicalâ€”mirror the internal shift ğŸ§ Choose silence or music over media when possible âœï¸ Freewrite a truth youâ€™ve been avoiding ğŸš« Track when/why you feel the urge to distract yourself ğŸ” What donâ€™t you want to see or hear right now? Be curious, not harsh ğŸ—£ï¸ Begin to say what you really mean (on paper or aloud)

notes.title: WEEK 5
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 5: Recovering a Sense of Possibility

Focus:

Challenging the limiting beliefs that keep you small and opening up to the idea that more is possible for youâ€”more freedom, more creativity, more joy. This week is about saying yes to potential and no to self-doubt.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes

ğŸ§  Scarcity mindset keeps us stuck ğŸšª Limiting beliefs can be rewritten ğŸ’¡ Wanting more doesnâ€™t make you selfish ğŸŒ± Possibility grows from curiosity and action

ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

ğŸ’­ List your limiting beliefs (e.g., â€œIâ€™m too late,â€ â€œArt doesnâ€™t payâ€) ğŸ” Reframe those beliefs with new truths ğŸ§  Track how many times you say â€œI canâ€™tâ€ this week ğŸŒŸ Make a list of 10 creative wishesâ€”be bold ğŸ¯ Choose one and take one small step toward it ğŸ“¸ Vision Board or Pinterest dream board session âœï¸ Write a letter from your future, creatively fulfilled self ğŸ›‘ Notice where you self-sabotage or expect the worst ğŸ§¹ Clear something physical or digital to make space for â€œmoreâ€ ğŸ§ Listen for moments of inspirationâ€”follow where they lead

notes.title: WEEK 6
notes.content:
ğŸ“š Week 6: Recovering a Sense of Abundance

Focus:

Shifting from scarcity to sufficiency by examining your beliefs around money, worth, and creative value. This week helps you notice where you limit yourselfâ€”and start inviting more support, joy, and overflow into your life.

âœ¨ Core Chapter Themes

ğŸ’¸ Scarcity mindset restricts creativity ğŸ§  Money stories are often inherited and untrue ğŸ’› Treating yourself with care builds belief ğŸ Abundance is a mindset, not a number

ğŸ“‹ Weekly Tasks (pick your favs)

ğŸ“œ Write your money storyâ€”what you were taught, what you believe ğŸ§  List your top 5 scarcity thoughts (then reframe them) ğŸ’° Track how you spend and where you withhold (especially from yourself) ğŸ Buy yourself one small, meaningful creative treat ğŸ§º Declutter and donate somethingâ€”create flow ğŸ“¸ Create a â€œrich lifeâ€ moodboard (what abundance feels like for you) âœï¸ Journal: What would I create if you felt totally supported? ğŸ” Practice 3 daily affirmations about money, joy, or ease ğŸ›ï¸ Notice what feels luxurious and nourishingâ€”not performative ğŸŒ· Plan a low-cost Artist Date that feels decadent

âœï¸ Reflection Prompts

ğŸ–Šï¸ Where am I still afraid to receive more? ğŸ–Šï¸ What do I truly believe Iâ€™m worthy of? ğŸ–Šï¸ How does abundance already exist in my life?

ğŸŒ€ End of Week Check-In
